catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 821
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: studded helmet with short visor at front and four-tiered, wide spreading laced neck guard; curving face protectors with decorated buckskin, studs, and crests; heraldic metal disc with Sanskrit characters for the Buddhist deity Fudo; pair or thin, bladelike metal kuwagatas at front center with heart cutouts; neck guard held together with green ties; ochre colored knots around borders; has wooden stand
inscription:
Inscription

on brass disk, in Sanskrit (component b): [Fudō]
medium: Iron, gilt copper, deerskin, silk, and lacquer
title: Helmet with ornament bearing seed syllable for Fudō Myōō
